current-chamber.#text: IN THE SENATE OF THE UNITED STATES

official-title.#text:
To require the Director of the Office of Management and
		  Budget to prepare a crosscut budget for restoration activities in the
		  Chesapeake Bay watershed, and for other purposes.

			 Recovery Act of 2013

In this Act:

term.#tail:
means a type of natural resource management in

term.#tail:
means any
			 Federal or State program or project that directly or indirectly protects,
			 conserves, or restores living resources, habitat, water resources, or water
			 quality in the Chesapeake Bay watershed, including programs or projects that
			 promote responsible land use, stewardship, and community engagement in the
			 Chesapeake Bay watershed.

Independent
			 Evaluator for the Chesapeake Bay Program

text.#text:
There shall be an
			 Independent Evaluator for restoration activities in the Chesapeake Bay
			 watershed, who shall review and report on—

restoration activities and the use of
			 adaptive management in restoration activities; and

any related topics that are suggested by
			 the Chesapeake Executive Council.

{http://namespaces.cato.org/catoxml}enti.#tail: from among nominees submitted by the Chesapeake Executive Council.

text.#text: The Independent Evaluator shall be appointed by the

{http://namespaces.cato.org/catoxml}enti.#tail: 4 nominees for appointment to any vacancy in the office of the Independent Evaluator.

text.#text: The Chesapeake Executive Council may submit to the

a report
			 describing the review described in

			 every 2 years, the Independent Evaluator shall submit to
